Function.Description: The sqrt function returns the square root of its Number argument.

Brief.Overview: The sqrt function returns the square root of its Number argument.
Brief.Overview-Complex: The sqrt function returns the square root of a complex number.
Brief.Usage: The sqrt function is used to compute the square root of a number.
Brief.Usage-Complex: The sqrt function is used to find the number, when multiplied by itself, equals the argument of the expression. Do not use if an immediate type, such as a real number, would suffice. Since complex numbers are heap objects, they require more space and operations on these types are slower than on immediate types.

Syntax.Return: A complex number holding the square root of its argument X.
